meanings.definition: A tree-lined avenue or promenade in a Spanish-speaking country, especially in Barcelona.
meanings.sent1: The tourists strolled down the ramblas, enjoying the shade of the trees.
meanings.sent2: Barcelona is famous for its beautiful ramblas where people walk and relax.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels on the ramblas were having a race to see who could climb the highest tree.
meanings.sent4: The ramblas stretched out like a green ribbon through the city, connecting neighborhoods.
meanings.sent5: The scent of flowers on the ramblas filled the air with a sweet fragrance.

meanings.definition: A street or road with a central reservation planted with trees.
meanings.sent1: The city council decided to plant new trees along the ramblas to make it more scenic.
meanings.sent2: Cars drove slowly along the ramblas, enjoying the greenery in the middle of the road.
meanings.sent3: The birds on the ramblas were chirping happily, grateful for the shade provided by the trees.
meanings.sent4: The ramblas looked like a mini forest in the middle of the bustling city.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight filtered through the leaves of the trees on the ramblas, creating a dappled effect on the pavement.
